michaelrwatson, you're the fucking idiot. like ecchiles said, mkv is not a FORMAT at all, you ignorant ponce - it's merely a container. x264 is the format and both mp4 and mkv support the x264 format. Not to mention that mkv is actually a SUPERIOR container considering that mp4 does not support soft-coded subtitles, chapter marks, and several other features and mkv does. The only people who whine about mkv are the kids who live in mom's basement that only watch their movies on Xbox or PS3 because these are the ONLY things mkv isnt supported by. VLC supports mkv just fine, which is what grown-ups use. What a fucking tool.

Sorry I didnt notice until after my first comment, but he isn't the only idiot here. Edgyguy, 1080p is a RESOLUTION, not a quality. And since the original source here is just standard DVD and in 480p at that, this is NOT bluray quality and DEFINITELY not 1080p.
